page.title: 13Grovehill Playing Fields
page.content: These are between the houses in Grovehill and the open country. There are 2 artificial{cricket}pitches and 4 {football}pitches. Several adult football teams play there and some of the boys train there with the Hemel Dolphins, a boys team that plays in the Bushey friendly league. There is a {BMX track}(see p.14) and a children's playground with some swings, seesaws, slides, and a climbing frame. There are some new{allotments}and a {nature reserve}created by a local primary school and called Bank's Wood after one of their teachers. They planted trees and left some of it to grow wild. There is a field at the Eastern end of the playing area where horses from St.Agnell's Farm Riding School are kept and{riding}lessons, including jumping, are given.
